intro: Rhytachne minor, commonly known as the small rhytachne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
